alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Monroe and central Northampton Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 723 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rossland to Walnutport. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nazareth, Bangor, Slatington, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Bath, Walnutport, Belfast, East Bangor, Stormville, Danielsville, Kunkletown, Saylorsburg, Delaware Water Gap, Rossland, Berlinsville, Beersville, Brodheadsville, Stroudsburg and Roseto. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
